Detailed Description

template<bool t_bManaged>
class WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >

A palette wrapper class.

This class encapsulates a Windows color palette. A palette provides an interface between an application and a color output device, such as a display device.

The interface allows the application to take full advantage of the color capabilities of the output device without severely interfering with the colors displayed by other applications. Windows uses the logical palette of the application, a list of needed colors, and the system palette, which defines available colors, to determine the colors used.

A CPaletteT object provides methods for manipulating the palette referred to by the object. Construct a CPaletteT object and use its methods to manipulate its entries and other properties and to create the actual palette and a graphics device interface (GDI) object.

Definition at line 579 of file atlgdi.h.

)  [inline]
 

Replaces entries in the specified logical palette.

The AnimatePalette function replaces entries in the specified logical palette.

Parameters:
nStartIndex  Specifies the first logical palette entry to be replaced.
nNumEntries  Specifies the number of entries to be replaced.
lpPaletteColors  Pointer to the first member in an array of PALETTEENTRY structures used to replace the current entries.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::GetNearestPaletteIndex (  COLORREF    crColor )  const [inline]
 

Finds the nearest palette colour index.

This method returns the index of the entry in the logical palette that most closely matches the specified color value.

Parameters:
crColor  Color to look for.
Returns:
Returns the index of an entry in a logical palette. The entry contains the color that most nearly matches the specified color.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::GetPaletteEntries (  UINT    nStartIndex,
UINT    nNumEntries,
LPPALETTEENTRY    lpPaletteColors
)  const [inline]
 

Returns information about the palette object.

This method retrieves a range of palette entries in a logical palette.

Parameters:
nStartIndex  Specifies the first entry in the logical palette to be retrieved.
nNumEntries  Specifies the number of entries in the logical palette to be retrieved.
lpPaletteColors  Points to an array of PALETTEENTRY data structures to receive the palette entries. The array must contain at least as many data structures as specified by nNumEntries..
Returns:
The number of entries retrieved from the logical palette; zero if the function failed.

WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::operator HPALETTE (    )  const [inline]
 

Returns the palette handle.

Returns the HPALETTE handle attached to the palette object.

Use this operator to get the attached Windows GDI handle of the CPalette object. This casting operator supports direct use of an HPALETTE object.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::ResizePalette (  UINT    nNumEntries )  [inline]
 

Resizes the palette.

The ResizePalette function increases or decreases the size of a logical palette based on the specified value.

Parameters:
nNumEntries  Specifies the number of entries in the palette after it has been resized. Windows NT/2000 or later: the number of entries is limited to 1024.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 667 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::m_hPalette.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CPaletteT< t_bManaged >::SetPaletteEntries (  UINT    nStartIndex,
UINT    nNumEntries,
LPPALETTEENTRY    lpPaletteColors
)  [inline]
 

Sets palette information.

This method sets RGB color values and flags in a range of entries in a logical palette.

If the logical palette is selected into a device context when the application calls SetPaletteEntries, the changes do not take effect until the application calls CDCT::RealizePalette.

Parameters:
nStartIndex  Specifies the first entry in the logical palette to be set.
nNumEntries  Specifies the number of entries in the logical palette to be set.
lpPaletteColors  Points to an array of PALETTEENTRY data structures to receive the palette entries. The array must contain at least as many data structures as specified by nNumEntries.
Returns:
The number of entries set in the logical palette; zero if the function failed.
